quizzes.title: History Quiz: Game and Board
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, world, game. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The slaughter of what animal is forbidden in almost all states in India by law?
In Monopoly, one of the best-selling commercial board games in the world named after the well-know economic term, the course of the game is determined mainly by which two of these factors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chance and decision-making

questions.question: This childrens pursuit board game, sold by toy and game manufacturer, Parker Brothers, is based on the ancient Indian game, Pachisi.
The term for the conclusive position in one of the worlds most popular board games - chess, comes from the Persian phrase Shah Mat, which means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The king is dead.

questions.question: One of the oldest games in recorded history, this strategy board game, where the moves are defined by the roll of two dice, is believed to have originated in ancient Mesopotamia. Excavations and literary references indicate that it was also popular in ancient Greece, Rome, Persia, and the Far East.
To make this dish you would:  leave your cheese outside covered with loose cheesecloth, allow flies to lay their eggs inside the cheese, the maggots will hatch and then spread it on toast.  Enjoy!
This speciality comes straight from the outbacks of Australia.  It is the white larvae of the ghost moth that are often found in trunks and roots of trees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Witchetty grubs

questions.question: This Philippine blood stew is made by using the heart and blood of a pig.

This game, which requires complexity of strategy and a great deal of concentration, was initially created by ancient Chinese warlords and generals more than 2000 years ago to map out possible attacking positions.
This board game, first published by the Milton Bradley Company in 1931, derived from a guessing paper and pencil game, and has also a one-person puzzle version.

Although there are Chinese, English, Polish, Spanish, Italian, and Turkish variations of this game, played on a board of black and red square spaces, its origins can be traced back to 1600 BC ancient Egypt.
What happens if you play all of your letters during the game of Scrabble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You get an extra 50 points

questions.question: In Scrabble, a popular family board game created by architect Alfred Mosher Butts in 1938, words are formed on a 15x15 game board, with each letter giving the player different number of points (the rarer the letter, the more points it gives). How many points does the letter w award according to standard scrabble rules?

This game was independently developed by two great mathematicians of the 20th century, John Nash and Piet Hein. The life and work of the former was the inspiration for the Academy Award winning film A Beautiful Mind.  Name the game.

Since 1977, there has been an annual world championship of this game, which requires a strategy of much planning and looking further ahead in your opponent’s possible moves.  Goro Hasegawa popularized the game in Japan in 1975.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Game and Dish
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, game, games. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This dish of fresh squid is eaten alive and raw, even at the moment of swallowing it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ika sashimi

questions.question: This is a betting game in which two cards are initially dealt. The player may ask for an additional card, hoping to reach the ideal score of nine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chemin de Fer

questions.question: This dish is prepared in Norway.  Its name means cod soaked in plutonium.  It is dried whitefish soaked in lye, a strong solution of sodium or potassium hydroxide.
To eat this meal you would: wait for a fertilized egg until the 16th day of incubation, open it and swallow the fetus without removing anything from it except some feathers from your teeth.
In India, they consider this body fluid a sedative, especially if it comes from an animal like the ox.   Some people who study yoga will use the human form of it.
What is the name of the popular solitaire game, in which you alternate suits building down, and build up in the same suit on the aces?
In which of the following card games is the Queen of Spades to be avoided?
In this game, you make melds of 3 or more cards. You can go out with 10 points or less. If your opponent undercuts you, you lose the difference in your points.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gin Rummy

questions.question: In this game, played with 2 decks, you can make melds. Red and black threes have special significance and some cards are wild.
This was a common dish in England at the beginning of the century.  It contains raisins, sugar, chestnuts, rice, and 3 quarts of pork blood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood Pudding

questions.question: This is a special Eskimo dish. They gut this animal and stuff it with dead seagulls. Its left underground to mature for a while and then they would have a dinner feasts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gull-stuffed walrus

questions.question: In this board game moves are determined by dice rolls. Each player attempts to move around the board, from point to point, to get home.
This is the dictionarys meaning of this meal: stuffed derma; roasted fowl intestines with a seasoned filling of matzo meal and suet.
In this board game, neither player can see the value of the other players men.
In this card game, which is a predecessor to bridge, there is a trump suit, that can vary from hand to hand.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Plant and Body
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, brazil. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This deciduous tree, popular as Maidenhair Tree, was first used in China as a stimulant. It is generally accepted that it increases blood flow to the brain, stimulating memory, mental alertness and reducing mental fatigue.

It is generally accepted that this drink, introduced in England by the Greek professor Servopoulos, acts as a stimulant. It  invigorates the body, enhances the mental activity and fights drowsiness and fatigue.
This religion encourages vegetarianism.

The main components of this slow-growing perennial plant, often used as a general tonic, affect the physical and mental activity of the body, providing revitalising properties.  The English word of the plant derives from a Chinese term meaning man root.

This powerful tonic herb is recommended for supporting the long term energy of the body. It enhances the resistance against toxic stress reactions that cause exhaustion and improves physical and mental vitality. The plant is often used as a home remedy in Russia and China.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Siberian eleuthero

questions.question: This plant, which is native to Venezuela and northern Brazil, is named after a tribe. It is used for producing drinks with energizing and stimulating effect.

The leaves of this plant have been chewed by people in the Andes for centuries. It has been used particularly in high mountainous regions, where oxygen is scarce, because the plant gives a boost of energy and acts as a stimulant.
This two-player board game is a race, but sometimes you can win by getting farther behind.
It is a widespread myth that vegetarians cannot provide this to their body, because it could only be supplied from meat. However, it is found in soy, beans, nuts, milk, cheese, eggs, etc.
These are people who do not eat anything that is derived from animals.
This food, made by bees from the nectar of flowers, gives great energy to the body. This energy is used mainly for blood formation.
This card game is played by four players one of which is a dummy.
Mix 1 ts powdered sugar and 2 ts water with some crushed ice into a glass. Then add 2 1/2 oz bourbon whiskey and some mint sprigs on top.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mint Julep

questions.question: Studies have shown that this plant, known as Camellia sinensis, contains a chemical that boosts bodily defense systems. It also contains small quantities of caffeine and tannins that mildly energise the body and mind.
This nut, used in a number of cola drinks both for its aroma and refreshing qualities, contains caffeine, which explains its energizing effect.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kola nut

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Term and Foods
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, fruits, agents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these cooking methods does not involve hot oil or fat?
Which term does not belong with the others?
Which of these foods is generally poached in white wine?
High consumption of meat protein deprives the body of calcium.  Lack of calcium causes this disease.
This part of the worlds population is on a vegetarian diet.
This is the vitamin that vegetarians should take, as it is not found in plants.
This is the reason why vegetarian diet is good for humans.

options.text: Humans were herbivores at the beginning of their existence
Fruits and vegetables remain in the intestines longer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anatomically, humans resemble herbivores

questions.question: When you broil, where is the direct heat source?

options.text: There is no direct heat source; it uses indirect heat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Above the food

questions.question: The terms sweating and steaming refer to one and the same method of cooking.
The breast milk of a meat-eating mother can be this much more contaminated with pesticides, compared to the milk of a vegetarian mother.
Why are foods basted?

options.text: To give them a crunchy crust
To prevent them from drying out
To give them a brown surface

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To prevent them from drying out

questions.question: Vegetarian diet is rich in these agents, found mostly in fruits and vegetables. They are known to fight free radicals,  thus slowing down the process of aging.
Stir frying is a term used to describe two fast Chinese cooking techniques: chǎo and bào.
The term roasting is often used interchangeably with this word.
This is how much the risk of breast cancer increases, if a woman eats meat daily, as opposed to once a week only.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Hobby and Bermuda
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, chefs, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is regarded as the first internationally recognized celebrity chef?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie-Antoine Carême

questions.question: What type of meat is used in Chateaubriand?
In which of these hobbies is the hacky sack used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Circle kicking

questions.question: Origami is a hobby and an art of Chinese origin that uses solely what material for its creations?
Julie Child, known to many as The French Chef, was not French.
The city of Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, England is known as the home of what popular craft and hobby?
In the British Overseas Territory of Bermuda, kite flying is not just a hobby, but also an important part of which holiday?
Chef Jeff Smith of the Frugal Gourmet fame was removed from his TV show amid accusations of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sexual harrasment

questions.question: The only ingredients in a basic mayonnaise are oil and a whole egg.
There is no difference between blanching and parboiling.
Which ingredient for bread hurts the leavening (rising) ability?
What is the measure for hotness of a chili pepper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scoville scale

questions.question: This dessert was made in honor of a famous singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peach Melba

questions.question: Chef Wolfgang Puck is of German descent.
How many pleats are on a traditional Chefs hat (the Grand Toque)?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Sign and Hobby
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, matchboxes, dragon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Letterboxing is usually what type of hobby?
This Yin Sign associated with the Fire Element.  People born under that sign are genuinely nice people.
What is the hobby of collecting matchboxes and different match-related items called?
The popular number placement puzzle Sudoku was invented in 1979 in which country?
Herpetoculture is a hobby related to keeping a collection of what kind of animals?
This is a sign of power, wealth and success.
Personalities of this sign are either leaders or rebels.  Unless in a position of authority, males of this sign are outspoken critics of those above them.
It is the ninth Sign of the Chinese Zodiac.  It is best described as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Active and Agile

questions.question: 2006 is the year of this sign, described as a noble and honest creature.
The sign comes second.  Its personality is descibed as steady and supportive..
The first Sign of the Chinese Zodiac.  It is a Yang Sign commonly associated with the Water Element.
It is the 12th Sign of the Chinese Zodiac.  It is a Yin Sign associated with the Water Element.
It is a Yin Sign associated with the Wood Element, that some people like as a pet.  The sign before it can be fierce and the sign which follows it can fly.
This sign is positioned between the horse and the dragon.   In ancient China it was associated with wisdom and aesthetic beauty.
The American Philatelic Society is the U.S. organization of the fans of one of the worlds most popular hobbies. Which is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stamp collecting
